item.title: Zynga
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:16, topic:470719”]hmm, what do you guys think about this?

WSJ

Zynga Takes Gambling Step in Nevada

Zynga has taken its first official step toward offering real-money gambling games in the U.S. by filing preparatory paperwork in Nevada, as the embattled firm maneuvers to take advantage of a shifting legal landscape.


Not much potential. I Don’t know the exact numbers for Zynga’s target audience, but I would have to imagine it is in the range of people who aren’t avid gambers. What they are aiming to do is hop on the online market if Nevada opens their market for online gaming in the state(since online gambling is illegal in the US). Now, why do I say I don’t think it has much potential? They will get blown out by the brands that were big in the past and are big overseas(Fulltilt, pokerstars, etc).

Read full topic

item.title: Zynga
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:12, topic:470719”]According to a bigger time scale (Also note I don’t know much about stocks) but it looks like from january 2012 they went from 15, now down to like what 2.25?
I wonder what they did to make that happen lol[/quote]
Facebook going public happened. Before that occurred, Zynga was sort of the stock of facebook since the games it published were accessed by countless amounts of people(via adds, newsfeed, notifications,etc). When Facebook went public, there was a new market for facebook, and many people also sold their Zynga stock because the potential profit in the real company(facebook), so as a result stocks dropped for Zynga.

Not to mention Zynga has faced multiple lawsuits, the billion dollar(either 1 or 5billion, cbf to google) drop on draw something which isn’t very profitable and accusations of insider trading.

Read full topic
